definition: abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin
(interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)
roof tile/abbr. for 瓦特[wa3 te4]
that/those/then (in that case)/commonly pr. [nei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing

sentences.english: This ship will bear up to Havana.
There are no pretty virgins in Havana.
sentences.chinese: 在哈瓦那就没有纯粹的处女。

sentences.english: I can always come in on the glow from Havana.
sentences.chinese: 我总能靠着哈瓦那的灯火回港的。

sentences.english: I had met him on the street on my first day in Old Havana.
sentences.chinese: 我到了老哈瓦那城后的第一天，就曾在街上见过他。

sentences.english: People get their hair cut at the Plaza Vieja (Old Square) in Havana.
sentences.chinese: 人们在哈瓦那老广场剪头。

sentences.english: An early 1950s Buick speeds through the Havana streets.
sentences.chinese: 一辆50年代初的别克轿车正驶过哈瓦那的街道。

sentences.english: A late 1950s Chevy drives along the Havana coastline on Nov. 16, 2008.
sentences.chinese: 一辆50年代末的雪佛兰汽车驶过哈瓦那的海边。

sentences.english: Anyway, it is probably the best habano in the whole world.
sentences.chinese: 不管怎么说，这可能是全世界最好的哈瓦那雪茄了。

sentences.english: Children cool-off in a fountain in Havana October 7, 2006.
sentences.chinese: 古巴首都哈瓦那的孩童在喷泉里纳凉。

sentences.english: So, he sent the battleship "Maine" to Havana.
sentences.chinese: 所以，他把“缅因”战船派去了哈瓦那。

sentences.english: In1853, Cuban revolutionary Jose Marti was born in Havana.
sentences.chinese: 年，古巴革命志士马提于哈瓦那出生。

sentences.english: A shipload of supplies arrived in Havana, Cuba, last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚一船补给用品送达了古巴哈瓦那。

definition: Santo Domingo, capital of the Dominican Republic
Santiago, capital of Chile/San Diego, California

pinyin: Bu4 yi2 nuo4 si1 Ai4 li4 si1
Duo1 mi3 ni2 jia1 Gong4 he2 guo2
